snippet: A Florida judge ruled that the government of Ecuador is not entitled to recover about $600 million from two former bankers who fled to Florida after their bank failed.
abstract: Florida judge rules Ecuadorean government cannot claim about $600 million from brothers Roberto and William Isaias, two former bankers and major Democratic party patrons who fled to Florida after their bank failed; country had convicted men of embezzling and sued in Florida to recover funds.
lead_paragraph: A Florida judge ruled that the government of Ecuador is not entitled to recover about $600 million from two former bankers who fled to Florida after their bank failed.

headline.print_headline: The Americas; Ecuador: Government Loses Bank Case
